Issues.Title: Image overflows even after setting size
Issues.Body: This is about **Bulma**. This is a possible **Bug/Feature**. It's not a browser bug. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **0.7.2** My **browser** is: Google Chrome v74 I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate** ### Description After setting image size to be 64x64. A differently sized image overflows, a similar thing doesn't happen when setting as a ratio. ### Steps to Reproduce ``` ``` ### Expected behavior ![expected](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6277011/56078659-41e84080-5e08-11e9-92fd-57fa1df6a102.PNG) ### Actual behavior ![actual](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/6277011/56078661-457bc780-5e08-11e9-8311-8303dbc7f051.PNG) ### Solution using Bulma as it is right now ``` ```

Issues.Title: Feature request: tagfield
Issues.Body:
Bulma seems to have multiple select: https://bulma.io/documentation/form/select/
But the dropdown seems to be always visible.
Wouldn't it be nice bulma to have also tagfield? e.g. something like this:

 
![tagfield](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/41240312/56016844-99a28100-5d0e-11e9-94aa-c89ef9e18f7e.jpg)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Feature request: tagfield" (#2446)

Issues.Title: Bulma CSS being changed by Font Awesome icons
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**. It's a **bug**. Not a browser bug. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** [0.7.4] My **browser** is: Google Chrome & Safari I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**? **No** ### Description Using icons from FontAwesome 5 messes up tile css from Bulma. Testing tiles without any icons from FA: The code for above screenshot: ``` Testing tiles
Test data in the tiles
Test data in the tiles
Test data in the tiles
``` The CSS after using a single icon (no `span` tags) is below. Notice the width b/w tiles is gone, font became bold, font type changed, and icon is showing up multiple places even though code only has it once: The code below: ``` Testing tiles
Test data in the tiles
Test data in the tiles
``` The only thing that changed is the first child tile uses an icon now. Same thing with enclosing the icon in a `span` tag. ### Steps to Reproduce 1. Add icons from FontAwesome to a bunch of tiles ### Expected behavior 1. Icons get added without changing font-type, color, boldness, space between tiles, etc. ### Actual behavior 1. Font type, color, boldness, space between tiles changed.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Bulma CSS being changed by Font Awesome icons" (#2424)

Issues.Title: Question about bd-* classnames
Issues.Body:
Hi,

Been using Bulma for a while and I recenlty found in some examples classname suffixed by 'bd-' (as an example 'notification' class is 'bd-notification').

What does this 'bd-' stands for and what is the purpose of it ?

Thanks !

Issues.Title: is-spaced documentation missing?
Issues.Body: This is about **the Docs**. This is a question/I need help. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **Docs** I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**? I searched for `is-spaced` in the issues, but did not find anything mentioning it. ### Description There is a class called `is-spaced` in the sass file of the component of navbar (https://github.com/jgthms/bulma/blob/master/sass/components/navbar.sass#L278) and it is being used for the top navbar of the documentation too, but it is not documented (https://bulma.io/documentation/components/navbar/) It adds extra padding to the navbar. Is this missing from the documentation? ### Steps to Reproduce Look at the source code of the top navbar of Bulma documentation: ### Expected behavior Documented ### Actual behavior Not documented Related issue: https://github.com/Fulma/Fulma/issues/180
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "is-spaced documentation missing?" (#2426)

Issues.Title: Question: input/iextarea/select styled by default
Issues.Body:
Hi, is there any proven way to style inputs, textareas and selects by default? That means, i don't want to set classes to inputs, they will be styled anyway. I came with something like this for now:

```
textarea,
input[type="text"],
input[type="password"],
input[type="datetime"],
input[type="datetime-local"],
input[type="date"],
input[type="month"],
input[type="time"],
input[type="week"],
input[type="number"],
input[type="email"],
input[type="url"],
input[type="search"],
input[type="tel"],
input[type="color"]{
  @extend .input;
}
```
Is it good approach? O do i miss something?

And how do i implement this to the select field? Thank you.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Question: input/iextarea/select styled by default " (#2437)

Issues.Title: Grey background flash on navbar-item
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**. ### Overview of the problem This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** I'm using Bulma **version** [0.7.4] My **browser** is: Chrome 73.0.3683.86 ### Description I'm attempting to control a dropdown showing/hiding via Angular. Per the docs, I've removed `is-hoverable` and I'm explicitly managing `is-active` via `mouseenter` and `mouseleave` events. Functionally, everything works, but there appears to be a lingering grey background color applied to the `navbar-item` that appears be activated on `:hover` but I can't seem to control it. It results in a grey flash on click (see attached gif). ### Steps to Reproduce Relevant code - `nav.component.html` ```
person Customer
New Customer ``` `nav.component.ts` ``` export class NavComponent implements OnInit { dropdownIsActive = false; constructor() { } ngOnInit() { } hideDropdown() { this.dropdownIsActive = false; console.log('hiding the dropdown'); } showDropdown() { this.dropdownIsActive = true; console.log('showing the dropdown'); } } ``` ### Expected behavior No grey flash upon clicking a dropdown item. ### Actual behavior Grey background flash upon clicking dropdown item (see attached). ![Kapture 2019-04-01 at 14 26 12](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/4032049/55351122-86c8ba80-548b-11e9-907d-580cc966f981.gif)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Grey background flash on navbar-item" (#2433)

Issues.Title: Why bulma always show scroll when height content isn't than height screen?
Issues.Body:
I have a question why scroll always display when my content isn't over than height for height of screen. I must set style `overflow-y: auto;` into tag html. Set like that I afraid that will have hidden problem about responsive or display scroll.
Are anybody can confirm for me about capacity have problem when set css like that?

My bulma version: 0.7.4
Chrome version: 73.0.3683.86 

![QA](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/8912039/55332079-d5dc1300-54be-11e9-9002-5e381f856b84.png)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Why bulma always show scroll when height content isn't than height screen?" (#2432)

Issues.Title: Update tiles documentation
Issues.Body:
This is a **documentation fix**.

It is unclear what is meant by "parent tile" (the containing HTML element or the `is-parent` tile), so this clarifies the documentation to say "containing tile" instead of "parent tile".
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Update tiles documentation" (#2427)

Issues.Title: No control over the size of the widget.
Issues.Body:
This is about **Bulma**.

### Overview of the problem

I'd like to use Bulma to design a widget, which will be integrated in many different sites.
Therefore I have no control over **html font-size**, on which Bulma relies upon, to size it's elements, apparently (**rem**).
Also, there are files *base/minireset.sass* and *base/generic.sass*, that are tampering with host site **html & body**.
Another thing is, no to control over the margins, paddings, etc...

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework**
I'm using Bulma **version** [0.7.4]

### Description

Although I've overridden *minireset.sass* and *generic.sass* and **nested** them inside my class. Now they don't interfere with the host website design. I propose to refactor **html & body** out  of them.

But the main question remains: what do I do with the sizes? Or maybe I miss anything?
16px is too large for my widget, 14px is much better.
And the margings, paddings, spacings, ... are too large as well.

Maybe we should have 2 more initial variables, on which everything else will depend?
So we have an option not to rely on html.
Say:
```
$font-size 16px !default
$spacing-ratio 1 !default
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "No control over the size of the widget." (#2428)

Issues.Title: Dropdown menu inside a hamburger menu
Issues.Body:
This is a **question**.

### Overview of the problem

So, when I add a dropdown menu inside a hamburger menu, on mobile, the dropdown menu doesn't correctly show up.

![Screenshot from 2019-03-23 22-16-29](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/45340167/54871735-8fe5c780-4db9-11e9-8368-160066b86307.png)

I'm using Bulma **version** [0.7.4]

### Steps to Reproduce

Just add a dropdown menu inside a navbar hamburger menu and you will find this problem.

### Expected behavior

The dropdown menu should be silent till activated.

### Actual behavior

The dropdown menu is already active and weird.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Dropdown menu inside a hamburger menu" (#2422)

Issues.Title: WIP: Initial start of bulma dark theme
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->
<!-- DO NOT REBUILD THE CSS OUTPUT IN YOUR PR -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is a **new feature**.
<!-- New feature? Update the CHANGELOG.md too, and eventually the Docs. -->
<!-- Improvement? Explain how and why. -->
<!-- Bugfix? Reference that issue as well. -->

### Proposed solution
<!-- Which specific problem does this PR solve and how?  -->
<!-- If it fixes a particular Issue, add "Fixes #ISSUE_NUMBER" in your title -->

This adds a dark theme to Bulma via the `@media (prefers-color-scheme: dark)`. Its obviously far from done but I'm opening this as a WIP to see whether its something that could be merged in the future or whether it should be kept outside of Bulma.

### Tradeoffs
<!-- What are the drawbacks of this solution? Are there alternative ones? -->
<!-- Think of performance, build time, usability, complexity, couplingâ€¦) -->

I don't believe this should add a huge amount to the buildtime or anything but it does mean a dark/light version of Bulma must be maintained.

Issues.Title: Fix 'align' attribute in td/th being ignored- Fixes #2414
Issues.Body:
This is a **bugfix**.

Fixes issue #2414:
There are multiple `<td>` and `<th>` selectors which set `text-align:left` taking precedence over the elements' attribute `align` (from HTML versions lower than HTML5)

### Proposed solution
From  `<th>` and `<td>` selectors which set `text-align` deselect elements with attribute `align`.

### Tradeoffs
None detected

### Testing Done
Tested in Firefox 66.0 and Chrome 73.0.3683.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Fix 'align' attribute in td/th being ignored- Fixes #2414" (#2420)

Issues.Title: Cannot Import utilities/mixins
Issues.Body:
<!-- PLEASE READ THE FOLLOWING INSTRUCTIONS -->

<!-- Choose one of the following: -->
This is about **Bulma**.

<!-- Is it about Bulma or about the Docs? -->
<!-- Is it a bug/feature/question or do you need help? -->
<!-- If it's a bug, is it a browser bug? -->

### Overview of the problem

<!-- UNCOMMENT THE APPROPRIATE LINES -->

This is about the Bulma **CSS framework** 
<!-- This is about the Bulma **Docs** -->
I'm using Bulma **version** [0.7.4]
My **browser** is: chrome 73.0.3683.75 (Official Build) beta (64-bit)
This is a **Node-Sass** issue: I'm using version [4.11.0]
This is a **Sass-Loader** issue: I'm using version [7.1.0]
I am sure this issue is **not a duplicate**.

### Description

I cannot import utilities/mixins.

### Steps to Reproduce

1. Setup scss webpack project
2. Try to import utilities/mixins
`@import "~bulma/sass/utilities/mixins";`

### Expected behavior

Not to error.

### Actual behavior

Errors.
```
Module build failed (from ./node_modules/sass-loader/lib/loader.js):

@import "~bulma/sass/utilities/mixins";
^
      Media query expression must begin with '('
```

Most of these media query type errors are due to missing `;`, though I am not missing any semicolons. Here's my code surrounding the import.
```
  1 @charset "utf-8";
  2 // @import "~bulma/bulma";
  3 @import "~bulma/sass/utilities/functions";
  4 @import "~bulma/sass/utilities/initial-variables";
  5 @import "~bulma/sass/utilities/mixins";
  6 @import "~bulma/sass/utilities/derived-variables";
  7 @import "~bulma/sass/components/navbar";
  8 @import "~bulma/sass/base/generic";
```
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Cannot Import utilities/mixins" (#2419)

Issues.Body:
